ul.li1: 291 A man who is reproved, being stubborn of neck—
ul.li2: suddenly he will be broken, and there will not be healing.
ul.li1: 2When the righteous are numerous, the people will rejoice,
ul.li2: but when the wicked are ruling, people will groan.
ul.li1: 3A man who loves wisdom will make his parents glad,
ul.li2: but the friend of prostitutesOr “whores” will squander his wealth.
ul.li1: 4By justice a king gives stability to a land,
ul.li2: but a man of bribes will ruin it.
ul.li1: 5A strong man who flatters his neighbor
ul.li2: is spreading a net for his feet.
ul.li1: 6In transgression, an evil man is a snare,
ul.li2: but the righteous will sing and rejoice.Hebrew “he will rejoice”
ul.li1: 7The righteous knows the case of the poor,
ul.li2: but the wicked does not understand knowledge.
ul.li1: 8Men of scoffing set a city aflame,
ul.li2: but the wise turn away wrath.
ul.li1: 9If a wise man goes to court with a foolish man,
ul.li2: then there is rankling and ridicule,Hebrew “there is ridicule” but there is no relief.
ul.li1: 10Men of blood hate the blameless,
ul.li2: and they seek the life of the upright.Or “soul,” or “inner self”
ul.li1: 11A fool gives all his breath,Or “spirit”
ul.li2: but the wise holds back in quiet.
ul.li1: 12A ruler listening to a word of falsehood,
ul.li2: all his officials are wicked.
ul.li1: 13The poor and a man of oppression have this in common:
ul.li2: Yahweh gives light to the eyes of them both.Literally “light of the eyes of the two of them”
ul.li1: 14A king who judges with truthfulness to the poor,
ul.li2: his throne will be established forever.
ul.li1: 15As for a rod and reproof, theyHebrew “it” will give wisdom,
ul.li2: but a neglected child is disgraced by his mother.
ul.li1: 16With the increase of the wicked, transgression will increase,
ul.li2: but the righteous will look on his downfall.
ul.li1: 17Discipline your children, and they will give you rest,
ul.li2: and they will give delight to your soul.Or “life,” or “inner self”
ul.li1: 18When there is no prophecy, the people cast off restraint,
ul.li2: but as for he who guards instruction, happiness is his.
ul.li1: 19By words, a servant is not disciplined,
ul.li2: for he will understand, but there is no giving heed.
ul.li1: 20You see a man who is hasty in his words:
ul.li2: there is more hope for a fool than him.
ul.li1: 21He who pampers his servant from childhood,
ul.li2: arrogance will be his end.Literally “and its/his end will be arrogance”
ul.li1: 22A man of anger will stir strife,
ul.li2: and the owner of anger, much transgression.
ul.li1: 23The pride of a person will bring him humiliation,
ul.li2: and the lowly of spirit will obtain honor.
ul.li1: 24Being a partner with a thief is hating one’s life;Or “soul,” or “inner self”
ul.li2: a curse he will hear, but not disclose.
ul.li1: 25The fear of a person will lay a snare,
ul.li2: but he who trusts in Yahweh will be secure.
ul.li1: 26Many are those who seek the favorLiterally “faces” of a ruler,
ul.li2: but from Yahweh one obtains justice.Literally “comes justice for a man”
ul.li1: 27A man of injustice is an abomination to the righteous,
ul.li2: but the uprightLiterally “upright of way” is an abomination to the wicked.
